title: Why is Katarina's difficulty level so high?
body:
Seriously, why is her difficulty level so high? She's not even hard to play. In fact, Katarina has a higher difficulty level than Jayce. Yeah, a higher difficulty level than {{champion:126}} . Why is this? That is not even close to being right. Jayce actually takes a fair amount of skill to play. I would know, I main him. I've mained him since level 3 and I still haven't completely mastered him yet.

So I want a good explanation, or at least an attempt. Why is Katarina's difficulty level so high, even higher than Jayce's, when she is not even hard to play?

replies.body: Perhaps because Kat can be effectively shut down by anyone with decent CC and half a brain.

not all cc seems to work on her.

I main Leona and my shield bash doesn't break her ulti at all. Its really annoying, cause you can ulti kats ulti, but by the time it kicks in the damage has been done.

Jayce is literally 1 skill shot... Kat requires a whole lot of mashing. Also, Riot gives pretty much all Assassins a high skill rating because most of them are melee and squishy.

But when you see Fiddle has a level 9 difficulty rating, you know its all horse crap LOL

Yeah Fiddle is actually difficult to keep alive though. Honestly, his Ult and drain are the only two decent damage abilities he has. His Q is way too short a fear and his E is just a silence. Easy to jungle with, hard to kill people with.
He is the slowest champ in the game, his fear is less effective then a root or a stun which is what he needs for his w and he is squishy. his kit is all you can do to deal damage and live

More like why aren't YOU in challenger?

The difficulty rating thing is completely bogus. Just ignore it. 

Kat is not hard. The only thing about her that is even remotely hard is choosing when to engage or not. But seriously that's kind of the same with all champions, maybe just a little more so with her.

Now, I'm not one to put too much faith in those difficulty stats but let's assume it's based on the "ideal" professional scene environment. By the very fact you never see her played there, and what people have said about her in this thread, you can assume that Kat is incredibly difficult to play and thus deserving of such a high score. If the stat was able to reflect every skill ranking it would vary but since it doesn't, there is nothing to stop you from using your best judgement and disregarding it completely.

every champion in the game is hard to play effectively lol, but kat is actually high difficulty because she requires a lot of positioning knowledge and how resets work.

I believe the reason for Kat's difficulty being so high is because of the skill required to make decisions with her. Because as others have mentioned anyone with even a little understanding of the game will know how to shut her down. I played against a Katarina the other day as Vayne and she already had 20 stacks by 13 minutes. At 20 minutes I asked her what happened to her stacks as they had fallen to 3 and she was like "you happened". Which was because I deliberately saved my e for a counter engage. Which basically eliminates Katarina's combo instantly meaning she becomes an easy pick. Which is why you need to have good overall awareness of situations. Look for engages where you know you will be able to get your combo off without any interruptions. Whilst admit her difficulty level could be lowered there's a lot more to playing Katarina than the simple e in ult e out.
Yeah I do have to say, that when you survive her all in and she ults at the end, cancelling that pretty much screws her over.

If you think about it she actually requires skills to play. Any champion with CC can shut her down immediately. Katarina just comes off as a really easy champion because anyone in low elo does not know how to counter her lol.
